title: Replacing the Top of a Rain Bird Valve

subtasks: Determine if replacement of the entire valve is necessary
Check if solenoid and diaphragm are available separately for purchase
Evaluate cost-effectiveness of replacing only the top and internal parts
Drain water from valve hole using a hand pump
Wipe the valve clean to prevent debris entry
Turn off water supply to the irrigation system
Depressurize the valve by turning the solenoid half a turn
Remove wires connected to the solenoid
Remove the old diaphragm, being careful not to lose the spring
Prepare the new diaphragm and spring, ensuring proper orientation
Align the new top assembly onto the old valve and secure screws in a criss-cross pattern
Strip the ends of the electrical wires
Connect the solenoid wires to the hot and common wires using waterproof connectors
Replace the valve box and backfill the hole
